397 
 
  
COURSE/DEGREE AWARDING 
INSTITUTIONS  
REQUIREMENTS    
UTME SUBJECTS  
SPECIAL CONSIDERATION (WAIVER) REMARKS  
DIRECT ENTRY  UTME  
      
CURRICULUM   AND   
INSTRUCTION  
NDU                                    
Science options:  
(i) Biology       
(ii) Chemistry  
(iii) Physics    
(iv) Mathematics  (v) Physical 
Education.   
 (vi) Health Education.  
Social Science  
(i) Geography/Physics    
(ii) Economics  
(iii) Political Science    
Arts Options  
(x) English Language    
(xi) French    
(xii) Religious Studies  
(xiii) History    
(xiv) Fine and Applied Art.  
AAU      
(with options in:)  
(i) Biology  
(ii) Chemistry (iii) 
Mathematics iv) Physics  
v) Pre-Primary and Primary Education  
  
  
CURRICULUM STUDIES  
EKSU  
LASU  
UYO      
  
  
Two (2) ‘A’ level 
passes or NCEmerit 
including the 
relevant subjects.  
Five (5) SSC credit 
passes including 
English Language.  
  
Any three (3) subjects chosen 
from Arts/Science.  
  
DIRECT ENTRY:  
(i) BSU runs long Vocation programmes.  
(ii) NDU – Same as Vocational and Technical Education.  
  
  
  
UTME:  
(i) AAU and BSU require Mathematics and any three (3) 
Science subjects for Science options.  
(ii) NDU requires  
(a) for Science, five (5) ‘O’ level credit passes in English 
Language, Mathematics, and any other three (3) 
subjects, two (2) of which must be Science subjects.  
(b) for Arts options: five (5) ‘O’ level credit passes in 
English Language and four (4) other subjects, three 
(3) of which must be Arts subjects.  
(c) for Social Sciences option: five (5) ‘O’ level credit 
passes in English Language, Mathematics and three 
(3) other subjects, two (2) of which must be Social 
Science subjects.
